pullRequest.body:
This adds four classes of C‚ãÜ-algebras (unital / non-unital, commutative / noncommutative). We only allow for complex scalars, as the theory for real scalars, perhaps counterintuitively, depends on the theory for complex scalars.

For all existing `CStarRing` instances, we also include the appropriate `CStarAlgebra` instance (so long as it actually makes sense). The purpose of this is (a) to reduce typing and the size of `variable` statements, but also (b) to hopefully reduce burden on type class synthesis.

Note: we leave `PartialOrder` and `StarOrderedRing` unbundled from `CStarAlgebra`. This is because, even in the most common cases (e.g., `‚ÑÇ`), the partial order can be controversial as a global instance. Moreover, including it wouldn't match the literature (although this point is not in and of itself sufficient justification). So, if your statement about C‚ãÜ-algebras requires `‚â§`, it is necessary to add these classes.

---

</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/283426bd-8134-448e-b699-36c5add70a3a) for commit 982666dabb975473111ed44c34e7906ab39d190f.
There were [significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/fae8f09a-19af-4835-bc29-9dfede8669d8/to/283426bd-8134-448e-b699-36c5add70a3a) against commit 0e1a0b8dd06824d82c5087e0431bbe73350f2b0f:
```diff
  Benchmark                                                               Metric         Change
  =============================================================================================
- ~Mathlib.Algebra.Algebra.Subalgebra.Rank                                instructions    20.1%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.ContinuousFunctionalCalculus.Instances   instructions     4.6%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.ContinuousFunctionalCalculus.Order       instructions     7.9%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.CStarAlgebra.Unitization                              instructions    23.0%
- ~Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Lp.lpSpace                                     instructions     8.6%
- ~Mathlib.FieldTheory.PurelyInseparable                                  instructions     5.2%
- ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.Cyclotomic.PrimitiveRoots                         instructions    23.5%
- ~Mathlib.NumberTheory.NumberField.Discriminant                          instructions    17.8%
+ ~Mathlib.RingTheory.Perfection                                          instructions   -16.6%
+ ~Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousFunction.StoneWeierstrass                   instructions    -8.3%
```
Closing in favor of #16953 to avoid a performance hit.

I would suggest
```suggestion
class NonUnitalCommCStarAlgebra (A : Type*) 
  extends NonUnitalNormedCommRing A, NonUnitalCStarAlgebra A
```

to save having to write the extra instances.
I feel like this is the whole point of `IsClosed` being a typeclass though...
`ULift` and `PUnit` would be good instances too, assuming the machinery is present elsewhere.

These instances and the ones elsewhere in this PR might make sense to spin out, in order to make this PR a bit smaller and to allow more scrutiny (in particular, you're missing the symmetric version of the `SMulCommClass` one).
Shouldn't we just require `NonUnitalCStarAlgebra A` here?
